sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update table="x_62500_mealplan_diet"> <x_62500_mealplan_diet action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <description>Use only halal-certified meat and avoid gelatine, which is usually from non-halal animal sources. Avoid all pork products: this includes foods such as biscuits, pastry and cakes that may have pork fat added (pork fat may be labelled as animal fat). Avoid all food and ingredients containing alcohol. Avoid all animal fat except butter. Compliancy is to be based on ingredient compliancy and not provision of halal certification provided by manufacturers. It is not necessary to use separate cooking pots and utensils for halal food, provided adequate cleaning processes can be demonstrated. A food safety program should be able to demonstrate adequate separation of halal and haram foods.  Different denominations of Islam may have different views on which ingredients are halal or haram. Where this occurs we have coded to the strictest interpretation.</description> <image/> <name>Halal</name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2024-04-06 19:35:52</sys_created_on> <sys_id>615286579711021069a3b6fce053af15</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2024-04-06 19:35:52</sys_updated_on> </x_62500_mealplan_diet> </record_update>
